name: NSGestureRecognizerDelegate
desc: A set of methods for fine-tuning a gesture recognizerâ€™s behavior.

items.name: func gestureRecognizer(NSGestureRecognizer, shouldAttemptToRecognizeWith: NSEvent) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should attempt to recognize gestures for a particular event.

items.name: func gestureRecognizerShouldBegin(NSGestureRecognizer) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should transition out of the Possible (NSGestureRecognizerStatePossible) state.

items.name: func gestureRecognizer(NSGestureRecognizer, shouldRecognizeSimultaneouslyWith: NSGestureRecognizer) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if two gesture recognizers should be allowed to recognize their gestures simultaneously.

items.name: func gestureRecognizer(NSGestureRecognizer, shouldRequireFailureOf: NSGestureRecognizer) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if the current gesture recognizer must wait to recognize its gesture until the specified gesture recognizer fails.

items.name: func gestureRecognizer(NSGestureRecognizer, shouldBeRequiredToFailBy: NSGestureRecognizer) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if the current gesture recognizer must fail before another gesture recognizer is allowed to recognize its gesture.

items.name: func gestureRecognizer(NSGestureRecognizer, shouldReceive: NSTouch) -> Bool
items.desc: Called, for a new touch, before the system calls the touchesBegan:withEvent: method on the gesture recognizer. Return NO to prevent the gesture recognizer from seeing this touch.
